fields_of_interest: General and Institutional Affairs, Economy, finance and the euro, International co-operation and development, Education and training, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Environment, Research and innovation, Climate Action
eu_initiatives: Circular Economy Club closely follows any initiatives and policies related to circular economy and dedicates in spurring collaborations among all sectors and industries.
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
goals__remit:
Circular Economy Club (CEC) is the international network of circular economy professionals and organisations. CEC’s activity is non-profit, global and open, anyone can join the club online for free. The club has over 2,600 members, that are either professionals (designers, engineers, researchers, consultants, business leaders) or organisations (national networks, companies, academia institutions, NGOs and startups).  
 
CEC exists to spur collaboration by connecting professionals, because together we can have a higher impact. The main activities are disseminating information and tools for circular economy professionals, providing mentorship to young leaders and startups and organising circular economy events.  
 
Although the club was founded by Anna Tarí in London, CEC is ran voluntarily by engaged club members based all over the world who volunteer to coordinate CEC activities in their cities by applying to the Local Organisers program.
